properties.name: AMEG
properties.people: John Nissen, Peter Wadhams, Stephen Salter, Brian Orr, Peter Carter, Sam Carana, Anthony Cook, Gary Houser, John Hughes, Graham Ennis
properties.description_short: AMEG is a group of determined scientists, engineers, communicators and others, dedicated firstly to establishing what is really happening to our planet (especially in the Arctic) using the best scientific evidence, and secondly to finding effective and affordable means to deal with the situation, thirdly to communicating these matters.

properties.name: Appropedia
properties.description_short: Appropedia is a green living wiki for collaborative solutions in sustainability, appropriate technology and poverty reduction. It is an open site for all matters of international development and aid, encouraging the sharing of information and collaboration with others in order to lighten our ecological footprint and live rich, sustainable lives.

properties.name: BITNATION
properties.people: Susanne Tarkowski Templehof, Ty Cabaya, Abhimanyu Dayal
properties.description_short: BITNATION provides a full range of services traditionally offered by governments. Among these are: a cryptographically secure ID system, blockchain based dispute resolution, marriage and divorce, land registry, education, insurance, security, diplomacy and more, through a fully distributed platform.

properties.name: Detroit Water Brigade
properties.people: DeMeeko Williams, Danny McGlashing, Justin Wedes, Makita Taylor, Rodney Deas, Shamayim Harris, Mike Turner, Beulah Walker
properties.description_short: Detroit Water Brigade is a volunteer-led alliance of compassionate citizens of Detroit and their international allies working to bring emergency relief to families facing water shut offs.

properties.name: Ethereum
properties.description_short: Ethereum is a platform and a programming language that makes it possible for any developer to build and publish next-generation distributed applications.

properties.name: Extinction Symbol
properties.description_short: The Extinction Symbol asks you to create or replicate the symbol wherever you can. The symbol represents extinction. The circle signifies the planet, while the hourglass inside serves as a warning that time is rapidly running out for many species.

properties.name: Geeks Without Bounds
properties.people: Willow Brugh, Lindsay Oliver, Lisha Sterling
properties.description_short: Geeks Without Bounds is an accelerator for humanitarian projects.

properties.name: Language Extinction Risk
properties.people: Tatsuya Amano, Brody Sandel, Heidi Eager, Edouard Bulteau, Jens-Christian Svenning, Bo Dalsgaard, Carsten Rahbek, Richard G. Davies and William J. Sutherland
properties.description_short: Many of the world's languages face serious risk of extinction. Efforts to prevent this cultural loss are severely constrained by a poor understanding of the geographical patterns and drivers of extinction risk.

properties.name: hack4good
properties.description_short: Geeklist #hack4good unites the world's leading minds to build solutions to humanity's greatest problems.

properties.name: Hacker Global Space Program
properties.description_short: The aim of the Hackerspace Global Space Program is to coordinate between hackerspaces to enhance cooperation and reduce reinvention of the wheel.

properties.name: Hexayurt Project
properties.description_short: Free Hardware housing for the world.

properties.name: Humanitarian OSM Team
properties.description_short: The Humanitarian OpenStreetMap Team (HOT) applies the principles of open source and open data sharing for humanitarian response and economic development.

properties.name: OpenBazaar
properties.people: Brian Hoffman, Sam Patterson, Braden Glasgow, Washington Sanchez, Delain Markos, Jonas Nick, Dionysis Zindros, George Chatzisofroniou, Angel Leon
properties.description_short: OpenBazaar is an open source project to create a decentralized network for commerce online that has no fees and cannot be censored.

properties.name: Open Droplet
properties.description_short: Open Droplet is an open source, open hardware water measurement sensor that is networked and easy to use.

properties.name: Open Oil Data Framework
properties.description_short: OpenOil believes that oil and gas production can benefit the citizens of producing countries more effectively.

properties.name: Open Source Beehives
properties.description_short: The Open Source Beehives project is a network of citizen scientists tracking bee decline.

properties.name: Open Source Ecology
properties.description_short: The mission of Open Source Ecology (OSE) is to create the open source economy. An open source, libre economy is an efficient economy which increases innovation by open collaboration.

properties.name: RoboBees
properties.people: Robert Wood, Gu-Yeon Wei, Radhika Nagpal, Greg Morrisett, Joseph Ayers, David Brooks, Stacey Combes, L. Mahadevan, Shiram Ramanathan, Todd Zickler
properties.description_short: The RoboBee is a tiny robot capable of tethered flight, developed by a research robotics team at Harvard University.

properties.name: Sea Shepherd
properties.people: Captain Paul Watson, President Roger Payne, Vice President Ethan Wolf, Secretary/Treasurer Ann Prezyna, Lani Blazier, Robert Wintner
properties.description_short: Sea Shepherd uses innovative direct-action tactics to investigate, document, and take action when necessary to expose and confront illegal activities on the high seas.

properties.name: STAR-TIDES
properties.people: Amy Gorman, Samuel Bendett, Dr. Linton Wells II, Nelly Mobula, LouElin Dwyer, David Becker, Andrew Mascelli
properties.description_short: Sharing To Accelerate Research - Transformative Innovation for Development and Emergency Support

properties.name: Tesla Motors
properties.people: A group of Silicon Valley engineers and more than 6000 employees
properties.description_short: Tesla Motors, Inc. is an American company that designs, manufactures, and sells electric cars and electric vehicle powertrain components.
